ranked_diseases.explanation: This condition is a classic manifestation of Albright's Hereditary Osteodystrophy (AHO), which perfectly matches all three provided phenotypic features: obesity (HP:0001513), short metacarpals (HP:0010049, as part of brachydactyly type E), and intellectual disability (HP:0001249). It typically involves resistance to parathyroid hormone.

Similar to Type 1A, Pseudohypoparathyroidism Type 1C also presents with the full spectrum of Albright's Hereditary Osteodystrophy features, including obesity (HP:0001513), short metacarpals (HP:0010049), and intellectual disability (HP:0001249). This type differs primarily in its molecular basis and can sometimes present without parathyroid hormone resistance (as seen in pseudopseudohypoparathyroidism, which is phenotypically similar).

Individuals with Down Syndrome commonly exhibit intellectual disability (HP:0001249), and can develop obesity (HP:0001513) in later childhood or adulthood. Brachydactyly, which includes short metacarpals (HP:0010049), is also a frequently observed skeletal feature in this syndrome.
